situation: A few players are playing a boardgame. The current state of the game is as follows. The dugong shouts at the finch. The lizard does not want to see the finch. And the rules of the game are as follows. Rule1: If you are positive that one of the animals does not fall on a square that belongs to the flamingo, you can be certain that it will enjoy the company of the songbird without a doubt. Rule2: For the finch, if you have two pieces of evidence 1) the dugong shouts at the finch and 2) the lizard does not want to see the finch, then you can add that the finch will never fall on a square that belongs to the flamingo to your conclusions.
question: Based on the game state and the rules and preferences, does the finch enjoy the company of the songbird?
label: proved
